oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Poem "Someone is just as lonesome as you" written by WWI soldier J. R. Young
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A poem handwritten on the back of a military form by J. R. Young (Division Quartermaster) from 409 Army Post Office, a plaintive set of verses addressed to his "Pal" speaking of the lonesomeness felt by a great many men in wartime. The last lines"Now won't some kind person lend the lonesome one a hand,�But if you don't, he won't be worth a damn, To you, to me, to himself or to our dear old Uncle Sam."
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
